thread.title: Even If the Fed Raises Rates, Bank Stocks Could Suffer
thread.title_full: Even If the Fed Raises Rates, Bank Stocks Could Suffer

title: Even If the Fed Raises Rates, Bank Stocks Could Suffer
text:
WSJ PRO Even If the Fed Raises Rates, Bank Stocks Could Suffer If the Fed signals that it will hold off on future rate rises, falling expectations for bank interest income will sink shares. By john.carney@wsj.com Sept. 15, 2015 2:16 p.m. ET 
The market is transfixed by the U.S. Federal Reserve and the question of whether it will raise its target rate this week. But, for banks, what the Fed projects about where rates will be at the end of next year may be far more important. 
Interest rates are one of the most important drivers of bank earnings. Higher rates push net interest income higher. And that tends to push up the valuations of bank shares. 
That is because... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In Popular on WSJ
